sentence.Network_en: Nowhere in Britain has bureaucratic centralization proceeded with more pace than in Scotland.
sentence.Network_cn: 在英国，官僚集权化发展最快的就是苏格兰了。

sentence.Network_en: Two of the most important dimensions of structure are centralization and departmentalization.
sentence.Network_cn: 在组织结构中最关键的两个维度是集中化和部门化.

sentence.Network_en: Centralization: lower managers are not capable at making decisions.
sentence.Network_cn: 集权: 较低层次的管理者不能制定决策.

entry.tran: 使权力中央化;对…集权控制
entry.def: To centralize a country, state, or organization means to create a system in which one central group of people gives instructions to regional groups.

example.ex: In the mass production era multinational firms tended to centralize their operations...
example.tran: 在大规模生产的时代，跨国公司往往实行集权化经营。

example.ex: The economy of the times made it difficult to support centralized rule.
example.tran: 当时的经济状况不利于实行集权统治。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of consolidating power under a central control

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,由-ize+-ation组成,"……化"或"发展过程"

stems_affixes.word_buile: central中心的,中央的+ization……化→n.集中,中央集权化
industrial工业的,产业的+ization……化→n.工业化,产业化
organ器官,组织+ization……化→n.组织,团体,机构
